He PANS over to the other two college boys on the dock here - ARCH, a big, good-natured, easygoing WASP jock ; and SKIP, Mr. Preppy, the perfect image of the lazy spoiled, indulged, and reckless upper-crust kid. Skip also happens to be Muffy's cousin.   Yeah, Kit, where is he?  Here she comes... He's a real hi-tech freak and Ivy League wiseass, a free spirit in neo-punk neck curl and button-down shirt. Your fly's open.   Your fly's open. Ok, so don't believe me. He keeps the tape rolling. Rob discreetly looks down. His fly is open. Kit looks at him dubiously. Rob zips. Chaz beams, getting it all for posterity. The engine finally engages. The ferry lurches.  fastens onto Nan, immersed in one of her books. He carries his own.   Whatcha readin'?      The origins of American pornographic film. I'm taking an independent study this term.  My advisor's really behind me on it. We're not gonna be sheltered college kids all our lives. Someday I'm gonna have kids -- you're gonna have kids ­ and someday that kid's gonna come up to me and say, 'God, Dad, porn's really a major part of our lives. You were there, how'd it get started?' I wanna be able to answer their questions. Besides, it's research I can do by myself.   April Fools... you crazy jerks. You crazy motherfuckin' jerks... somebody could've gotten hurt out there! Relief descends. Rob isn't laughing. But nobody's more impressed than assistant Buck, still treading water.  Oh, too bad. Skip extends a hand to Buck to help him out.  Mom, I am home! They all look to see him standing in the entrance to the living room.   Wow, look at this...!   Look! Our very own place settings... with our very own place cards -- with Ken or Barbie! Outasight!  Don't anybody move! Chaz jumps back from the table, whipping out his videocam to record the moment, and panning them all at · .their respective places.  One of us in this room...  ...pulls his wang. Unless Muffy knows something about us we don't. He blows Arch a kiss, pulling the two beds apart again.         That depends on what he's on. Rob and Kit cross their path, heading down to the water in their swimsuits and overshirts.   Respectable young Quaker couple returning after quiet afternoon of nonviolent sex.  Well, if it was Skip...  Me too!  Wait a minute! Look at this! He has found on the little pebbled beach beside the dock, Skip's switchblade. It is in pieces. There's blood on the broken blade.  This was Skip's.  You mean split up?  No luck.  He isn't with you?      What about the ferryman?  What?  Wait a minute. Aren't we supposed to be staying together? Where're Muffy and Rob?  And Muffy?  What nurse's shoes?  What?     I didn't find anything.  That's right. I spent the night with Nikki. What about you?  What's your little secret?  Oh, come on, sport. I walked in on you last night , and you were acting like your ass was on fire...     I haven't. There is a slight pause. Rob comes into the living room, holding a flashlight and stands just inside the doorway. The others shift uncomfortably.  Nikki, come on...  What are you doing?   We're all supposed to stay together here.  So what are you going to do? Just waltz on down to the pier. By yourself. Check your bag with the porter. Then wait for an ocean liner to happen by and pick you up. Is that it?  What if the Constable never even comes?  Look, just relax--  Nikki, now just hold on a minute, and look at me. Look at me. She stops and looks at him.  Now, am I nervous? Yes. Maybe even a little bit scared? Yes. Am I running around like a chicken with its head cut off?  No. I mean, come on, babe. Lighten up a little, huh? He quickly slips the S&M mask over his head, clowning around.                          Skip?!        This time, no funny business.     Why? What do we mean to each other anyway?      Sure. Pause.  Yeah.  Yeah, she really got us good.  Go back and scare the shit outta her for a change? Outrageous!  Pussies.  All right! A real catfight!   Outasight!  What the fuck was he talking about anyway? We might find something around after we dock? They walk out onto a private peer and eye the boats moored there.  Oh.  Well, now we've been identified.  It's getting late.  Who cares? Let's get this show on the road! He starts running to the boat. Rob reluctantly follows.   Did you find a key? How're we going to get the motor started?  She wouldn't come out? Doesn't she care about me? No one answers him.  How do I look?   Will you quit kicking me? It hurts.   No. I'm dead. You're blowing the whole thing. Where's Muffy?   What?  Look, she's been dragged away.  We could follow the trail.
dialogues.Muffy: Shit.   No, Clara, thanks. Just trying some last minute straightening down here... god, I don't think I've ever worked so hard in my life...!   Nope, you're a peach, Clara. But this one's mine. I told my father I'd do it, and I will. My way. I don't want him to have any excuses.   Nice? It has to be better than nice... it's gotta be bloody unforgettable! Clara climbs the stairs.  Bye, Clara. See you Monday. Soon there's the upstairs SOUND of the kitchen door closing behind Clara. Muffy finally props the mannequin, clearing away the remaining clutter. She goes to open a basement window for ventilation. It is a ground-level transom, hinged at the top. Through it Clara is visible departing the grounds. Then Muffy hears a DRIPPING. She turns, hesitating, and follows the sounds.     What's going on? Sam... what's wrong?  No, he's in Sutton Place. Why?      We keep all the keys on the board in the kitchen, but I think there's an extra one underneath the cushion there. She points to the boat seat. Potter is much obliged.  Well, there's an awful lot to be done with this place.  I will, if all goes well. Next month when I turn 21. It's my first- stage inheritance.  We used to spend our summers here before my mother died. This is a very special place to me.     Well, you know, everything they say about older men? It's true. Kit and Nikki stare at her, open-mouthed.  Add about thirty years.  It was only a weekend. It's over now.  I was curious.      It was quite a weekend. Nikki starts to laugh.     You fill out a lot of forms, and then some friend of your family gives you a job delivering mail in his ·corporation...         Why me?  In his "Life of Johnson" James Boswell said, "We cannot tell the precise moment when friendship is formed. As in filling a vessel drop by drop, there is at last a drop which makes it run over; so in a series of kindnesses, there is at last one which makes the heart run over." Arch has started to make snoring sounds.  So with this toast may our hearts run over and our friendships be formed. They stand unanimously, raise their glasses in agreement, start to drink and spill it all down the front of their shirts. Dribble glasses. Everybody groans.    Goodnight. Muffy leads Nikki to a narrow, sparse single, popping open the door.           Goodnight.      Goodnight, Arch. Gently but firmly, she extricates herself, closing the bedroom door behind her.            I... I was hungry... She bumps against the stove, backing away. She self-consciously runs a hand through her hair.  I... I must look a mess... She scuttles out the door to the utility room and the back stairs beyond, leaving the eggs to burn.  I... forgot to get dressed...   Something wrong? Rob rushes by her.        Eight-two-four-eight. Constable Potter has an office at his home.  Who wants some tea? It'll calm our nerves... She exits toward the kitchen . Nikki. perplexed by her behavior, looks strangely after her.  I didn't know what kind anybody would like so I just... got them all...     It happens sometime... But there's still the well all the island homes have some kind of pump... or well... for emergencies. Nikki reaches for a large flashlight beam.   I'm not worried. I'm sure those two... Skip and Art... they're just up to some kind of stupid trick . . . Kit moves out of the kitchen uneasily.       Here.  It's all right. It's Perrier. Suddenly the phone rings O. S. They all look toward the living room.     Good idea. Sometimes... with the tides... it can take someone all night to get here from the mainland... and even then, sometimes they don't make it...  I'm going upstairs.  This is my house. I'll be in my room. She turns and heads up the stairs. Pause.     You guys are really terrific. I love you all. And I thank you from the bottom of my heart for being such good sports.  Rob, you and Kit, you two were the best. You figured it all out. The clues really worked.  How about if I told you it was the script for a weekend special that's going to help me keep this house... Rob and Kit stare, mystified.     Once they were killed off, yes. Everybody had to cooperate. Otherwise, none of it would have worked!  Oh, there's a crazy twin all right, but his name isn't Buffy.      Kit Graham, meet my Uncle Frank St. John of St. John et Freres, Wall Street. Uncle Frank smiles and waves at Kit, but Harvey steps right over to him and starts pumping his hand.  Usually we don't even see Uncle Frank in the summer, he's so busy. But this time he made an exception.  Cal's our regular ferryman between the mainland and the islands around here... but I thought he was up to the dramatic challenge. Well, that's it. Now you know it all.     ...And I regret that, well, some of those fake clues I planted in the bedrooms I guess were taken too seriously. I'm sorry about that. She avoids looking at Nan so as not to draw attention to her.  But we had fun, didn't we? I mean, come on. She starts passing .out chilled champagne bottles to the men to open, and setting up glasses on a sideboard.  I know I'll never forget this weekend for as long as I live.  Where's Nikki?  Oh, Uncle Frank, he's been a great help this weekend, really. Let me get him out here so you can--  Nan! She hurries to catch up with her.  Let me say again how sorry I am. It wasn't intended.         What'd you forget now?  I know. The clean-up's going to take Clara and me at least a week.     You're kidding.  Those bastards...  Which ones?     Figures... Thanks.     I'll try not to act too surprised when they arrive.  You too, goofball. Skip hangs up.  Nikki, what on earth are you doing here? Is something wrong?  Oh, great. Where is Chaz? Nikki is already moving into the living room.  Maybe he stopped to shit in the woods. You know Chaz.  By the way, where did you get the boat to come back here?  I see.  What about your water?  That's okay. You go. I'll wait here.  I'm sure Chaz is fine. I'll stay here by the phone just in case. It's safer this way. Do you want a flashlight?  Good job, you guys. I'm really scared. The fun's over, Rob.  Sure. Sure. Let's see if the dead are ticklish, shall we?  Okay, okay, take it easy.      Skip! No! ! ! He makes a move to slit her throat, when Muffy kicks open the swinging door and sees...

Meaning, Chaz is Nikki's man, especially for this weekend.         I get it. That's a joke. Preppy Skip adds his greeting.  Except for Skip and Nan. Them we just met.  This is true. For as long as I've known her.     Muffers, Moffo, Muff-child , Muffin' stuff, the Muffster...     Harvey... are you planning a career in politics when you grow up?  Oh, just a hunch. God, I'm so ready for a change. Any kind of change.  Like how much older are we talking about? Twenty-six?  I don't believe ·you, St. John!  Come on! ·  Come to daddy. They all start to laugh now, wickedly, conspiratorially.  Come sit on daddy's knee, little girl... Nikki falls to the floor in hysterics.  St. John hospitality taken to the extreme.  Good choice, Arch.  I mean, what are you' supposed to do with a liberal arts major anyway?     You've outdone yourself again, St. John. The back screen door slams shut o.s. behind Skip, leaving the house. They look up.  Because you're the hostess. Muffy thinks for a moment, then adds...  Oh, great. Quarantine.  Another room. Muffy... Muffy turns back to her.   I know you and Arch had something going before I met him...  I found that out-- I guess what I'm trying to say is... you always seem to get there first... but this time Chaz is mine, OK?  Harvey? Mr. Junior Achievement? Oh please... Muffy returns her smile,continuing down the corridor.       You gotta be kidding...  Who wants to know?  Harvey? No kidding'? Maybe that explains your clothes.  Oh, c'mon. Muffy exits hurriedly, upset.  I don't like this... I definitely don't think I like this...  What's happening.  What!  Jesus. I'll go. Just point me in the right direction.    Boy, when she said `well,' she really meant 'well'. who dug this thing? Pocahontas? She reaches for the wooden bucket attached by metal nook to the thick rope. Harvey pre-empts.  You mean, back home on the farm?  Why?      What happened?  Harve.  You didn't.   I'm a big girl now. I think I ·can handle a few spiders and                  Oh, God! Not the water!  She's been acting less than normal anyway.  You mean all day and you haven't noticed?  ...and those nurse's shoes.  The clodhoppers she's been wearing today... crepe soles... It's as though some common nerve of suspicion has been touched. They all stir.  I found somethin"g in my room, too She reaches into her bag and pulls out the black rubber bondage hood.  ...only I don't think it was intended for me .                What do you mean, Nikki, come on? Don't give me any of this Nikki, come on.  Look, stay if you like. Lock your door. Dig a trench. Hang out. But once I leave this place, I'm never coming back. She walks out the door, and Chaz follows her to...  Yeah, that's been real effective... She goes into...   I can't stay here any longer. She goes back out into the hallway. Chaz follows.  Then I'll swim all the way back to the mainland... I can be strong if I have to.     Three people are dead and you're telling me to relax?  Nice image.  Very funny, Chaz.  Don't be a jerk.  Take that thing off.  Get out of here. She pushes him and he falls backward across the bed.  Chaz is still lying across the bed as last seen, except that now his hands cover his crotch.      Now I'm supposed to throw off my clothes and jump on you? Just wind her up and watch her go? You've got a lot to learn, buddy. No response. Chaz lies perfectly still. Not even his chest appears to be moving.   What is this? Show and tell? I'll show you mine if you show me yours? Well, forget it... You may as well just stick it back in your pants. Chaz?... Chaz? Say something, goddammit! She swats his hands away from his crotch. Beneath them, on his pants, is a slowly growing blood stain. Nikki gasps, her mouth contorting into a scream that will not come. She turns suddenly in response to .a NOISE O.S., and sees a DARK FIGURE stepping out from behind the slowly closing bedroom door.  We all got sucked in just as bad as you!  His name? Muffy smiles, directing attention toward "cousin" Skip.  It sure fooled me.  We have been had.            Chaz, I'm sorry.  More than this a couple of days ago.    I'll tell you what I've learned from all this. I'm tired of having one fling after another. I don't want any more of that. I want a boyfriend. Chaz? Will you be my boyfriend? He looks at her, slowly softening. Yes, he will. Rob turns away from Skip now, steps over and surveys the quiet group.  When anything g.oes, everything goes.   Go back and give her a taste of her own medicine, that's what we should do. Nikki steps. Leeks up, hearing herself. Skip returns the stare.  She sure wouldn't be expecting it...!   Buck, got any spare professional tricks you could throw our way! Buck looks up, confused, only now plugging in.      No, no, nothing's wrong. Chaz and I just figured there was nothing we had to get back to that couldn't wait and you could probably use a hand with the clean-up. It's our way of saying thank you.  Putting the boat up in the old boathouse. He'll be up in a minute.  I wonder what's keeping Chaz? He should have been up here by now.  Still... I'm beginning to not like this.  The boat? Oh, Cal gave us one.  Listen, I need a drink of water. You just stay here. I can get it myself. She walks out of the living room. Muffy looks after her and smiles to herself.  No, really. I don't want to go alone. I'm still scared from last night. Please come with me.         Fuck! She comes up sputtering to the surface of a small forest pool she has fallen into.  Fuck!! Who dug the goddamn swimming pool?!? She drags herself out.      We have to go to plan B.  A lot goddamn, fucking better than I do!  Muffy! Muffy! Come quick! It's Chaz...      Muffy!! She dashes into...  Muff--!!! ...and stops short. Muffy is lying face down in a pool of blood. Her throat's been cut. The useless phone receiver is clutched in her hand (making that constant phone company noise that lets you know the phone is off the hook).          Chaz, get up! ·Hurry, Chaz!... come on! He doesn't move.  Chaz, stop playing around! Get up!! She starts kicking him in the side.  Chaz! Chaz doesn't stir, but he does speak now without moving his lips.  It's supposed to hurt! The game's over! Get up!       Kit! Kit, come out! There is rustling O.S., then Kit starts to emerge.  She's gone! Nothing left, but the pool of blood and a thin trail of smeared drying blood to indicate that she's been dragged away.               Muffy! Muffy walks into the room , lowering the knife.  Somebody else is here! In this house!  Muffy, it's not a game anymore! Just then there is a loud CRASH o.s. of glass breaking down on the first floor. After the slightest pause there is another crash o.s., and another... Someone is smashing in all the bay windows along the back porch. Nikki screams.

C'mon I'm gonna need some help here. Buck obeys, but his way, enjoying it, ducking under the craft to swim to the other side to help.  And watch out for the wire! Too late. There's a sickening THUMP I The young assistant suddenly breaks the surface qf the water, panicked and stunned, gasping for air. It happens too fast for any of them to do anything. Buck thrashes, dazed, off-balance, falling back into the path of the ferry as it glides toward the landing.  Buck, look out--  Buck! The ferryman rushes forward to help. For a moment the others are spared the horror of it as the Ferryman's back blocks their view. But then Buck, thrashing in the water, tears himself, loose, screaming and bobbing. up, his head and torso covered in blood, the side of his face and his shoulder hideously deformed. It is awful. It is ghastly. And it is unforgettable.  Get away from him! Buck is hysterical. The gashes of torn flesh seem to drip from his skull. Seeing Rob and the others, he screams, lunging vainly at· them in agony.          Now? You just left

Old money never mixes family with friends.      Choose your weapons, big guy.  You up for a game of stretch?  Eat it.      First round, the champ! Then a sharp rapping sound very near, like a foot striking the wood flooring.  Who's there? Pause. No answer. We hear in the darkness the sound of his switchblade clicking open. And then he waits, straining his ears to hear. Finally, Skip reaches into his pocket, puils out his lighter and flicks it on. Something snags him from behind. Uncle Frank frowns at Skip as Cal enters.     Well, I know what I'd do, if I wasn't her brother...   Did I say anything? The others look at each other, a beat, registering.        Nothing. Hey, they're your friends.  That wouldn't be very sporting if I told you, would it?  Rob and Kit and Nikki and Chaz.  Well, Uncle Frank told me about his recommendations. ANGLE WIDENS to include Arch, who has been standing beside Skip the entire time.  A petty consistency is the hobgoblin of little minds.

To her it is funny. And soon Rob is laughing too. He swings his legs up under the covers beside her.     Muffy? No answer. He tries her door, but it's locked tight. A beat. Then:      You OK?   OK... well, goodnight... No response. He turns back for his room, catching sight of Chaz, who has come out of Nikki's room, to investigate, too.  I swear it wasn't this cold yesterday . "...Pursuant to our previous communication, please be advised that the patient under discussion has still not been found and returned to custody, and it now believed to be attempting to return to her home in your jurisdiction. If encountered, exercise extreme caution and notify us immediately, as Miss St. John has ·been a patient here for three years and is still considered incorrigibly unstable and extremely dangerous..." Kit looks up, frantic.  I don't know... but we've gotta get this boat started.  The house. Didn't Muffy say there was another key back in the kitchen?  We've got no choice.  Shit.  Huh?  I know.  I'd have you stay here, but--     ...it isn't going to end here.  Well...  Let's go.  Let's go. Brief pause, then he turns to go.  Shit... They move slowly off the dock.  Come on. That's how we're going in. Kit swallows hard. She nods.  Are you with me? They break from their cover and run, keeping low, to the side of the house. Pull it away...  Pull it away! They advance together on the painting, Rob keeping his flashlight on the eyes the entire time. description: A group of eight college friends gather together at an island mansion belonging to heiress Muffy St. John to celebrate their final year of school. They soon discover that each has a hidden secret from their past which is revealed, and soon after, they turn up dead. Yet, are they really dead? Or is it just part of some very real and cruel April Fool's jokes? The hostess, Muffy, is the only one who apparently knows what's going on. But then again, is it really her doing the killing?—Losman <losman@express-news.net>
